Then, another player plays the role of Dr. Motus.
In the competitive mode the first person to reach 4/5 victory points (depending on the number of players) will win.

COOPERATIVE MODE
I this mode we display 3 emotions cards in the center of the table and every player receives 3 image plaques. 
Dr Motus must pick one of the image plaques and place it on the table, without saying what emotion that cards mean for her. Then, all other players as a team try to guess the correct emotion. If they guess right, they win a point. In the cooperative mode players try to get the best score possible and compare it to a table.

Name: Knast Das Gesellschaftsspiel
Description:
On his turn as a snob, a player rolls two dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. There are opportunities to gain or lose money and there is a risk to be thrown in jail, which has a special track. On his turn as a prisoner, a player rolls one die and moves that number of spaces around the jail track with the opportunity to be released earlier than expected (and return as a snob) or to be sentenced to more time (more rounds) in jail. If the players punishment exceeds 25 years (each penalty measure is cumulative), he's out of the game.

The player who collects as a snob the critical amount of money to buy 2 expensive certificates, wins the game

Name: Animeter
Description:
The trees are full of tasty apples so it’s time for forest animals to have a feast! But to reach the fruit is not a simple task so animals decided to cooperate. One by one they climb on the tops of each other’s heads to form a tall tower. Hares use their long ears to lift their friends, hedgehogs chase off predators hiding between the leaves and tiny mice can reach apples in the hollows. How to make it to that mellow red apple?

In Animeter, each player can build up to 3 towers using 9 cards with various animals. Reach as many apples as possible and avoid dangerous predators. Use your sight: you cannot check the height of your towers during the round. Collect combinations of animals’ abilities. And, finally, after each player plays the final card, measure the towers ,and find out who gathered most apples and won the game!

-description from publisher

Name: Vampire: The Masquerade – Rivals: Blood & Alchemy
Description:
Trouble is Brewing.

Blood & Alchemy is an expansion for Vampire: The Masquerade - Rivals Expandable Card Game that adds two new clans: Tremere & Thin-bloods. The Tremere are masters of Blood Sorcery who draw incredible power from their Blood, while the Thin-bloods must mix a plethora of chemicals with their Blood to extract power from it. You may play these two clans head-to-head or simply integrate them with your Core Set to give you more options for mixing clans and creating new decks!

Features:

     Adds two new clans: Tremere & Thin-bloods. 
     Play these two clans head-to-head or integrate them with your Core Set.
     Includes a 30 card Crypt Pack to customize your decks!
     Designed for 2-4 players, ages 14+ to play in 30-70 min per game.


—description from the publisher

Name: Raptor Island
Description:
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/hayballgames/raptor-island-the-card-game/

A 2-5 player action card game where players encounter dinosaurs to acquire their DNA, fuel the escape chopper and escape Raptor Island.

Each player must start the game with a hand size of three cards. During the game you will always draw a card at the start of your turn from the play deck found in the middle of the table. After drawing, players may play one card on their turn to help them get closer to their goals, be it through scrying the top few cards of the deck, or forcing another player to hand over a card to slow their progress.

Finding Dinosaur DNA is your primary goal. They are one of many Item cards you can find in the deck alongside Flare, Tranquilizer Gun or Raptor Egg cards and many more.

As a collective, every player shares the second goal. A set number of Fuel cards must be played to the Fuel Stockpile for any player to win the game. Fuel cards are another Item card you can find in the deck.

Finally once you have the required number of Dinosaur DNA and sufficient Fuel has been played to the Fuel Stockpile, you are ready to play an Escape The Island card and WIN THE GAME.

—description from the designer

Name: Kingdom 1183
Description:
Kingdom 1183 is a smooth, yet intricate economy and warfare simulator driven by your ever-improving strategy. It is a combination of worker placement, resource gathering, economy management, and combat. Your fate in Kingdom 1183 is decided by your strategy and choices.

You will build and manage your own kingdom. There is no area to control, no shared board. Instead, you can choose from one of seven ways to win including combat-free solely economy-based victories. The game is played alone or with three friends and is expandable to eight players or more. All game modes can be played in team or free-for-all setups. Every night will be very different from the last.

—description from the publisher

Name: L'Neuvieme: A 9-Card Chase
Description:
The notorious thief L’Neuvieme has just committed their latest dastardly crime! Police tracked them to the small town of Nonaville, but the trail went cold there. As the world’s foremost private detective, you have been called in to track L’Neuvieme down and put them behind bars.

L'Neuvieme is a solitaire hidden movement and deduction game that can be played entirely in-hand. Over the course of nine turns, you will move around the quiet town of Nonaville, and receive clues as to L'Neuvieme's movement. However, some of these clues may be misleading, so you will have to use all of your deductive skills to pin down where L'Neuvieme is hiding.

At any turn, you can attempt to corner L'Neuvieme if you are confident you have found them. However, for each incorrect attempt you make, your score will decrease, and if you fail to successfully corner L'Neuvieme by the end of the ninth turn, they will evade you for good!

L'Neuvieme features 12 scenarios, and a number of optional modular variants, that add plenty of replay value to this quick game of cat-and-mouse. Do you have what it takes to send L'Neuvieme back to prison?

Name: Studies in Sorcery: Divination
Description:
Studies in Sorcery: Divination is an expansion for Studies in Sorcery that adds in the Divination project cards. The school of Divination has several major themes: 

     Place watchful Fate tokens to prophesy your opponent’s action and be rewarded for successful predictions.
     Manipulate perception, placing extra credit tokens and turning demerits into a positive. 
     Increase knowledge of hidden information which you can use against your opponents. 
     Be rewarded for surrendering yourself to fate and pushing your luck.


—description from the publisher

Name: Aventuria: Alternative Geschlechterkarten
Description:
This promo pack contains the four alternate gender hero cards and their respective talents cards for the four Aventuria base game heroes. They all have different talent points from their alternate gender card. Includes:

Inaniel Flötenträumer (EK) / Inaniel Whistledreamer (ES)
Rathelia Ricottini (HS) / Rathelia Ricottini (HR) 
Thallian Fuxfell (TM) / Thallian Foxfur (TM)
Hukla Tochter der Hogna (ZS) / Hukla daughter of Hogna (DB)

Name: Aventuria: Kickstarter Promo Pack
Description:
This promo pack (released during the first Aventuria Kickstarter) contains 4 new henchmen cards and a new adventure (7 cards):
2x Streunende Katze / Barn Cat (henchmen - KS01)
2x Krähenschwarm / Murder of Crows (henchmen - KS02)
1x Hexenreigen / Witch's Dance + cards - KS03-KS09 (adventure pack)

All cards are marked with "KS" and consecutive numbers (KS01-KS09).

Name: Pays d'Auge: Le jeu
Description:
Gameplay: similar to a goose game, but with 550 questions relating to geography, history, celebrities... of the area.
Players roll a dice to advance on the different circles after selecting their starting point.
The circles all have different colors corresponding to the themes (i.e. a yellow P for Personalities). 
Other spaces are "Replay" or "Luck".

'Goal: be the first to reach the spaces with the coat of arms. 
On these spaces, collect a photo card by answering the question correctly, get 5 and win.

Name: Star Fleet Battles: Shadow of the Eagle – Rulebook:  Captain's Module R4J
Description:
Romulans Got Warp!

From the earliest source material, it was noted that the Romulans developed warp power later than other empires. This title explores five alternate timelines, each triggered by a singular event, that result in the Romulans gaining warp technology at the same time as everyone else. 
This book has a detailed history, ship descriptions, four new scenarios, and the Master Ship Chart. 
The ships include the “W” warp-refitted ships, “Y” Early Years ships, Middle Years ships, and modern ships (warships, Police ships, and National Guard ships).

This 46-page rulebook includes descriptions of dozens of new warp-powered Romulan ships and also has the following scenarios: Internal Security; External Intruders (Romulans and Orion pirates), New Neighbors (Romulans and Klingons), Practical Experience (Romulans and Tholians), and Supply Raid (Romulans and Gorns).

This product describes additional ships for use in Star Fleet Battles. 
To fly the ships, you will need the SFB Module R4J SSD Book in either B&W or color. You must have the SFB Basic Set to utilize this material. Some of the ships require the Advanced Missions set or the SFB Master Rulebook.

—description from the publisher

Name: Ancient Terrible Things: Easy Focus and Doomed Scrawls Promo Cards
Description:
Promo cards for Ancient Terrible Things from Spiel 2014.

“Doomed Scrawls” needs "a pair + three of a kind".
Artwork unique to each card hand-drawn by the artist at Spiel 14 Pleasant Company Games booth.

“Easy Focus” rules variant card allowing for a more powerful Focus token effect.
